pros:
+ Good pay
+ Good benefits
+ Vacation time
+ 401k
+ Love my coworkers
cons: + Since Franklin bought us out (I came about three years after this happened), lots of things are "in flux" and very much being figured out - get the feeling that we're learning as we go. This is both a con and a pro. Franklin isn't a traditional college like we are, so some policies they enforce don't make sense, but I also get the sense that we're being looked out for and they funnel A TON of money into Urbana
No diversity and poor pay, long hours

pros: Great people, great coworkers, great students
cons: Franklin University doesn't care about anyone but themselves

ok salary but great career opportunities

job_title: Interim Vice President in Cedarville, OH
pros: Tremendous collegiality among the faculty and staff who are dedicated to making the university successful. Great support from Franklin University, parent organization.
cons: Low enrollments caused financial challenges, including multiple budget cuts.

job_title: Undergraduate Admissions Representative in Urbana, OH
pros:
Can take graduate classes as an employee for free
Dental, eye care, health, pet insurance are all available
cons: The company seems to be sinking and they will dismiss employees out of nowhere.  The overhead institution seems to be very distanced from the needs and functions of its new Urbana branch.

job_title: Volunteer Baseball Coach in Urbana, OH
pros: People at the university are nice and treat your with a lot of respect.
cons: Cold weather, and the university still adjusting with the sports programs
